12 brutal reasons to NEVER make friends at work:

1/ You might get too much help with challenges 
‚ö†Ô∏è Could ask for advice without fear of judgment

2/ You could make real, lifelong friends 
‚ö†Ô∏è You might start caring about your coworkers üò≥

3/ Danger of creating an enviously positive culture 
‚ö†Ô∏è People might actually like Mondays

4/ Might get invited to too many after-work events 
‚ö†Ô∏è You‚Äôll be forced to have fun on weeknights

5/ You could learn new skills by accident 
‚ö†Ô∏è Just by being around smart people

6/ Risk of honest feedback from people who care 
‚ö†Ô∏è Growth could become inevitable

7/ You might enjoy meetings 
‚ö†Ô∏è Yes‚Ä¶ even team meetings

8/ Risk of expanding your comfort zone without realising 
‚ö†Ô∏è And actually grow (scary right !?)

9/ You might become a better communicator 
‚ö†Ô∏è People may start calling you a leader

10/ New ideas might show up unexpectedly 
‚ö†Ô∏è Creative ideas flow better among friends

11/ Job satisfaction might reach record highs 
‚ö†Ô∏è Risk of becoming the most engaged employee

12/ Access to informal knowledge across departments 
‚ö†Ô∏è You might start to know too much!

I get it...

Keeping work "strictly professional" feels safer.

No drama. 
No getting hurt. 
No tricky stuff with projects and promotions.

But research shows friendship at work is a serious performance booster.

Because people need people.

And when you like who you work with, work gets easier.

Agreed?

text:
Saw this KitKat ad from last year and it still hits:

‚ÄúThe break you need after 7 Zoom calls.‚Äù

So simple.
So true.
So brutal.

It reminded me of a Microsoft study I came across around the same time ‚Äî and honestly, it stuck with me.

They ran fMRI + EEG scans on people with and without meeting breaks.

What they found?

Back-to-back meetings are one of the worst things you can do for your brain.

Here‚Äôs why breaks aren‚Äôt optional ‚Äî they‚Äôre essential:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Stress Reset: Even short meditation breaks prevent stress buildup.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Better Engagement: Breaks = better frontal alpha asymmetry = more present participants.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Sharper Focus: Beta waves stay balanced ‚Üí no burnout ‚Üí better thinking.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Well-being Wins: Especially critical in remote/hybrid setups.

So if you‚Äôre on call #6 today‚Ä¶

üì£ Take. That. Break.

text:
As a 2-times $1M founder, 

These are the 5 Things I Wish I'd Known Sooner:

üéØ Nobody Cares About Your Cool Solution
Let's be honest - I spent way too long being excited about features nobody asked for. People don't buy "nice-to-haves" - they buy "need-to-haves" that make their problems go away. How painful is the problem that you are solving?

üîç Get Picky About Who You Serve
I wasted months marketing to the wrong audience and burned cash and time through the process before getting it right. Find your ICP and refine it relentlessly until it's laser-precise. Don't even think about running ads until you've nailed exactly who you're talking to and confirmed they actually want what you're selling.

üå± Fish Where The Fish Are Biting
Look, some prospects are ready to buy now, and some will never be ready. I wasted so much time on the wrong people! Focus on high-intent channels where you can grab the low-hanging fruit. One good customer who's ready to buy beats ten who "might be interested someday."

‚è±Ô∏è Your Time Is Worth More Than You Think
This was a game-changer for me: before jumping into any task, I ask myself, "Can I automate this? Can someone else do this?" If you're doing $10/hour work when you could be doing $1,000/hour work, you're leaving money on the table.

ü§ñ AI Won't Save You (But It Can Help)
I got caught up in the AI hype too, buying tools I barely used, it‚Äôs not the answer to every question. Use AI to automate workflows and manual work to make more of your time. That's how I started building Fuelgrowth - to strike that balance. We use AI to get deep insights impossible for us to derive and to make efficient workflows, but we know it's the human touch that really makes marketing work. No robot can replace good content.

On a side note do you want to see what you're missing? My team is planning to offer a FREE Performance Review to a few companies that reach out to us. We combine AI insights with human expertise to analyse everything from details as minute as audio choices to even your influencer selection. We'll show you exactly how to make every marketing dollar count. Comment ‚ÄòSUPERADS‚Äô below or connect with me for a conversation

text:
Late Post! I was in Manila in September where I was invited to speak about "AI beauty revolution" by the Chamber of cosmetics industry in the Philippines. The Panel had a great mix of legal, data science and AI research experts. 

The discussion ranged from data security concerns, vertical AI use-cases for businesses, legal implications from widespread AI use and put simply how do we get started with incorporating AI in our day to day activities at work. 

Few takeaways from the discussion : 
1) Be open to adopting AI in your workflows to stay ahead of the market, look at what your global counterparts are doing or what your local competitors are doing and keep an open mind about the potential. 
2) Start small with AI use them for your daily communications with the customer, customer support automation,  employee knowledge centres and process automations. 
3) Keep an eye on the public and government policies on AI and how they evolve with time but don't let that slow your AI adoption. 
4) Incentivise and encourage your employees to use AI for daily tasks rather than making it a barrier, open up strategic roles to use AI and certain roles where there are confidential data keep strict policies to avoid data leaks. 
5) Various AI applications in providing a personalised experience to consumers at every touchpoint from Social media to website checkout to support.

Over all it was so encouraging to see so many successful entrepreneurs still looking to learn, evolve and keep pace with changing times. 

Many thanks to the fellow panelists who shared great insights and knowledge Guita Gopalan Alex Austria Kyle Patrick Bartido Ralph Vincent Regalado and to Diego Buenaflor for putting this together.

text:
Over the past few weeks, the team at Fuelgrowth has been heads-down, laser-focused on execution, customer obsession, and building serious momentum.

üåç As a founder building in the generative AI space across Asia, I‚Äôve had the opportunity to meet customers, partners, and investors across Singapore, Delhi NCR, and Bangalore. These conversations have provided valuable insights, and I wanted to share a few key patterns we‚Äôve observed in the market:

1. Early AI adopters are wary:
Many early adopters have faced challenges in realizing the promised value of AI. This has created skepticism, as tools haven‚Äôt consistently outperformed human capabilities across job functions. üö´

2. Unrealistic expectations slow adoption:
Buyers often expect AI to deliver end-to-end solutions, without requiring incremental user input. This mindset has delayed AI adoption, as stakeholders hesitate to engage with tools that still require human involvement. üîÑ

3. Enterprises are stuck in pilot mode:
While internal mandates for AI-driven cost optimization and growth exist, internal champions lack conviction. Many enterprises remain in the pilot phase, waiting for proven use cases before fully committing. ‚è≥

4. Midmarket and growth-oriented firms lead the way:
There‚Äôs a silver lining: midmarket and fast-growing companies are actively experimenting with AI use cases. These early adopters are willing to be patient, collaborate, and become your initial champions. For founders like myself, these are the partnerships that fuel early-stage growth. üí°

5. Offering ‚ÄúAI Outcomes as a Service‚Äù may be the answer:
Another path is positioning yourself as an agency, offering ‚Äúoutcome as a service‚Äù by using your product to automate internal processes and building case studies that showcase profitable results. This can help reduce the risk/reward ratio for clients and accelerate market adoption. üìà

The generative AI space is full of opportunity, but founders need to be strategic about how they approach the market. I‚Äôm eager to connect with fellow founders, investors, and enablers who are passionate about shaping the future of AI.
Let‚Äôs build together! ü§ù #AI #GenerativeAI #Entrepreneurship #Tech #Startup #AsiaTech #Innovation #Growth

text:
Static Ads Are Making a Comeback!

Yes, you heard me right.

Over the past three months, collaborating with various brands and agencies has revealed an intriguing insight that challenges the current market playbooks.

Our data and performance analysis comparing UGC reels and static ads clearly show a winner.

If you're a brand looking to leverage social media platforms to boost engagement across your funnel, static creatives must be part of your content strategy. Here are three compelling reasons why:

Reel Fatigue: Attention spans are dwindling, and users are becoming more selective about the content they consume. Static ads offer a refreshing change.

Cost and Authenticity Issues with UGC: User-generated content is becoming
increasingly expensive. Users are savvy and can spot a sales pitch a mile away. Brands need to push more authentic data through UGC to stand out.

Message Clarity: Static ads allow brands to convey their message quickly and clearly as users scroll. Well-designed static ads, when intelligently positioned and targeted, drive better results.

And the most crucial reason:

Efficiency in Performance Marketing: Today's performance marketing thrives on rapid iterations and A/B testing. Static ads are cheaper and quicker to produce, allowing performance marketers to experiment more freely and optimize data-backed campaigns for better outcomes.

If you're a marketer, brand owner, content/brand head, or P&L owner, and this resonates with you‚Äîor if you have contrarian views‚ÄîI‚Äôd love to hear from you.

#Content #PerformanceMarketing #AI #DTC #Growth

3Ô∏è‚É£ Crystal-Clear Messaging: Engaging with big players forces you to refine your messaging and positioning in the market. Being precise and clear becomes paramount, which ultimately benefits your entire brand identity.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Timing is Key: Navigating enterprise sales cycles, POCs, and sealing those game-changing deals alongside building your product is a marathon, not a sprint. It's crucial to tread carefully, leveraging feedback from fellow operators in the market to ensure your journey is a successful one.

How do visual cues influence your perception of a brand? üé®üëÅÔ∏è

Let's discuss and decode the language of marketing together!

Take, for instance, the captivating Febreze advertisement titled "Odour Chart" design by Procter & Gamble

At first glance, it may seem like a simple depiction of cheese, onion, and egg ‚Äì yet beneath the surface lies a complex interplay of semiotic elements.

In this ad, the use of these common household items transcends their literal meanings. They serve as powerful symbols, evoking not only the sensation of odor but also triggering memories and emotions associated with unpleasant smells. üå¨Ô∏èüí°

Through this clever manipulation of visual cues, Febreze subtly communicates its message of odor elimination without uttering a single word.

This ingenious utilization of semiotics underscores the profound impact that visual stimuli can have on brand perception. üí≠‚ú®

By tapping into our subconscious associations, advertisers can craft narratives that resonate deeply with consumers.

As the world is still digesting all the updates Sam Altman announced earlier this week https://lnkd.in/gCZarrKc.  

Here are some of my initial thoughts : 

‚≠ê Wrappers on top of chatGPT with horizontal usecases and no data moat will all be eaten up by OpenAI eventually. All these usecases will eventually have a single interface that is chatGPT. 

‚≠ê Infrastructure and guardrails are safe and is still a good space to build in but based on what I have seen in the last 3-4 months everyone who initially wanted to build LLMs at the start of the year is now building the Infra layer - unless you can distribute and scale fast the space is heating up super quick. 

‚≠ê Vertical AI usecases with deep expertise and data moats will have winners faster than the infra layers which is waiting for winners to evolve in this space. If you peel few layers there are diamonds to unearth here and clear differentiations to build similar to how people have built products on Shopify app stores and other platforms, we will see big moves and winners in this space. 

‚≠ê OpenAI Appstore is a game changer and will only increase AI adoption incrementally. It will be a key distribution channel for AI apps moving forward. 

If you are not building in AI today, it still early days and not too late. AI is changing how humans work fundamentally and job descriptions in the near future will look very different! 

What are your takeaways and thoughts on what's next ? Does this change your AI strategy ?

text:
My interactions with DTC/agency operators and founders over the last 1 year has thrown light on some interesting observations on the what is happening in the DTC market. 

1)  There is very little differentiation on product these days hence competition for keywords is huge. 
2) ROAS  has been going down while CAC is increasing leading to brands and agencies fight it out to retain their market share instead of growing. 
3) Profitability at very early stages of brand building is now the norm which is also a pressure point for marketers and agencies.  Reasons : lesser venture money to burn and current market sentiments. 
4) Gone are the days where you could rely on performance marketing to be a differentiator. Every DTC brand has access to an agency/operator who knows performance marketing and there is very little moat here. 
5) Creatives is where the differentiation lies today. Every DTC brand is a now a content creation or a story telling house. The budgets for and Qty of creatives being churned out is increasing every day. 

Key learnings - Measure your creatives performances closely, automating your creative and performance marketing workflows will help brands reduce CAC and also improve ROAS. 

If you are a DTC founder, enabler or agency operator,  I would love to hear your thoughts on how you are navigating today's climate while building brands. 


#dtcmarketing #creative #contentmarketing #performancemarketing #dtcbrands
